forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 11am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 13 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a thick layer of clouds cloaks the city in a blanket of muted gray. The air is cool and a touch damp, a characteristically chilly embrace for the end of December. The forecast hints at rain, imminent and persistent — a gentle rhythm that will underscore the morning hours. Gazing toward the horizon, one might notice the faint outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge, its grandeur partially obscured as the early light struggles against the shroud of low-hanging clouds, hinting at the possibility of the marine layer quietly retreating by afternoon.

The day ahead poses challenges to those longing for outdoor excursions, yet it invites more reflective pursuits. A light jacket, perhaps layered with a cozy sweater, and a sturdy umbrella stand as the attire of choice for the day’s adventures. Consider a visit to a local café, where one can sip a hot brew and indulge in the comfort of a favorite read, all while watching the droplets dance against the window. Later, the clouds may part enough to offer patches of blue, inviting a stroll along sheltered pathways or a visit to a museum, where the brilliance of art provides a worthy distraction from the chill outside. Though the weather may appear dreary, it offers a unique charm, inviting introspection and the warmth of simple pleasures.
